trans-unit.source: Demonstration – Validity Dates and Multiple Commission Recipients

seg-source.mrk: Demonstration – Validity Dates and Multiple Commission Recipients

trans-unit.source: This demonstration provides an overview of how to use validity periods for commission rates and how to use multiple commission recipients on one customer with the identification of the primary recipient.

seg-source.mrk: This demonstration provides an overview of how to use validity periods for commission rates and how to use multiple commission recipients on one customer with the identification of the primary recipient.

trans-unit.source: Scenario: Kevin, the sales manager at CRONUS, decides to increase the sales volume within the LONDON responsibility center for a specific item. He grants Mark, who is responsible for that area, higher commission rates for a short period to push this project.

seg-source.mrk: Scenario: Kevin, the sales manager at CRONUS, decides to increase the sales volume within the LONDON responsibility center for a specific item.
He grants Mark, who is responsible for that area, higher commission rates for a short period to push this project.

trans-unit.source: In addition, he grants Adam Green, who was the responsible commission recipient for the customers in Great Britain serviced from the LONDON responsibility center, an extra commission for these customers.

seg-source.mrk: In addition, he grants Adam Green, who was the responsible commission recipient for the customers in Great Britain serviced from the LONDON responsibility center, an extra commission for these customers.

trans-unit.source: Susan, the sales order processor, enters a new sales order after Mark visits a customer and receives a new order.

seg-source.mrk: Susan, the sales order processor, enters a new sales order after Mark visits a customer and receives a new order.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the month, Arnie, the accounts receivable administrator, creates the commission statements, verifies several values and then issues the commission statement for Mark and Adam.

seg-source.mrk: At the end of the month, Arnie, the accounts receivable administrator, creates the commission statements, verifies several values and then issues the commission statement for Mark and Adam.

trans-unit.source: Specify Commission Rates for Validity Periods

seg-source.mrk: Specify Commission Rates for Validity Periods

trans-unit.source: Phyllis, the accounting manager, enters Marks’ commission rates for item 1964-W, INNSBRUCK Storage Unit. The commission rate is only valid for sales orders posted from February 11th to 15th, 2019.

seg-source.mrk: Phyllis, the accounting manager, enters Marks’ commission rates for item 1964-W, INNSBRUCK Storage Unit.
The commission rate is only valid for sales orders posted from February 11th to 15th, 2019.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to enter commission rates:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to enter commission rates:

trans-unit.source: On the cc|commission menu, click Commission Rates.

seg-source.mrk: On the cc|commission menu, click Commission Rates.

trans-unit.source:
In the header, set the following filters:
  • Sales Type Filter = Customer Commission Group
  • Comm. Recipient Type Filter = Commission Recipient
  • Comm. Recipient Code Filter = C-0005
  • Type Filter = Item
  • Code Filter = 1964-W

seg-source.mrk: In the header, set the following filters:
• Sales Type Filter = Customer Commission Group
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">Comm.
Recipient Type Filter = Commission Recipient
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">Comm.
Recipient Code Filter = C-0005
• Type Filter = Item
• Code Filter = 1964-W

trans-unit.source:
On the first line, enter the following information:
  • Sales Code = RETAIL
  • Commission Type = Percent
  • Commission = 6
  • Starting Date = 02/11/19
  • Ending Date = 02/15/19

seg-source.mrk: On the first line, enter the following information:<div class="ccDIV"><ul start="1">
• Sales Code = RETAIL
• Commission Type = Percent
• Commission = 6
• Starting Date = 02/11/19
• Ending Date = 02/15/19

trans-unit.source:
On the next line, enter the following information:
  • Sales Code = STANDARD
  • Commission Type = Percent
  • Commission = 6
  • Starting Date = 02/11/19
  • Ending Date = 02/15/19

seg-source.mrk: On the next line, enter the following information:
• Sales Code = STANDARD
• Commission Type = Percent
• Commission = 6
• Starting Date = 02/11/19
• Ending Date = 02/15/19

trans-unit.source: : Commission Rates for Mark Colins for item 1964-W

seg-source.mrk: : Commission Rates for Mark Colins for item 1964-W

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Commission Rates page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Commission Rates page.

trans-unit.source: Allocate Multiple Commission Recipients to One Customer

seg-source.mrk: Allocate Multiple Commission Recipients to One Customer

trans-unit.source: Phyllis re-allocates Adam Green to the customers in Great Britain serviced from the LONDON responsibility center. Adam receives 25% from the normal commission calculated for sales documents of these customers.

seg-source.mrk: Phyllis re-allocates Adam Green to the customers in Great Britain serviced from the LONDON responsibility center.
Adam receives 25% from the normal commission calculated for sales documents of these customers.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to allocate multiple commission recipients to customers:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to allocate multiple commission recipients to customers:

trans-unit.source: On the Sales & Marketing menu, click Sales > Customers.

seg-source.mrk: On the Sales & Marketing menu, click Sales > Customers.

trans-unit.source: Locate and select customer 50000, Guildford Water Department.

seg-source.mrk: Locate and select customer 50000, Guildford Water Department.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Commission Recipients.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Commission Recipients.

trans-unit.source: On the next line, in the Commission Recipient No. field, enter C-0002 (Adam Green).

seg-source.mrk: On the next line, in the Commission Recipient No.
field, enter C-0002 (Adam Green).

trans-unit.source: In the Share % field, type 25.

seg-source.mrk: In the Share % field, type 25.

trans-unit.source: : Commission Recipients for customer 50000

seg-source.mrk: : Commission Recipients for customer 50000

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Customer Comm. Recipient Catalog page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Customer Comm.
Recipient Catalog page.

trans-unit.source: Locate and select customer 60000, Blanemark Hifi Shop.

seg-source.mrk: Locate and select customer 60000, Blanemark Hifi Shop.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 3–6.

seg-source.mrk: Repeat steps 3–6.

trans-unit.source: Locate and select customer 61000, Fairway Sound.

seg-source.mrk: Locate and select customer 61000, Fairway Sound.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 3–6.

seg-source.mrk: Repeat steps 3–6.

trans-unit.source: Locate and select customer 62000, The Device Shop.

seg-source.mrk: Locate and select customer 62000, The Device Shop.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 3–6.

seg-source.mrk: Repeat steps 3–6.

trans-unit.source: Create Posted Sales Document Lines for Items

seg-source.mrk: Create Posted Sales Document Lines for Items

trans-unit.source: Susan, the sales order processor, enters a new sales order after Mark visited his customer 60000, Blanemark Hifi Shop and made a new order on February 7, 2019. Since the order can be delivered directly, Susan can post the shipment and the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: Susan, the sales order processor, enters a new sales order after Mark visited his customer 60000, Blanemark Hifi Shop and made a new order on February 7, 2019.
Since the order can be delivered directly, Susan can post the shipment and the invoice.

trans-unit.source: On February 14, 2019, Susan enters the next new sales order after Mark has visited his customer 61000 Fairway Sound and made a new order. The order can be delivered directly. Susan can post the shipment and the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On February 14, 2019, Susan enters the next new sales order after Mark has visited his customer 61000 Fairway Sound and made a new order.
The order can be delivered directly.
Susan can post the shipment and the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to enter and post two sales orders:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to enter and post two sales orders:

trans-unit.source: On the Sales & Marketing menu, click Order Processing > Sales Orders.

seg-source.mrk: On the Sales & Marketing menu, click Order Processing > Sales Orders.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click New and then press ENTER.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click New and then press ENTER.

trans-unit.source: In the Sell-to Customer No. field, enter 60000.

seg-source.mrk: In the Sell-to Customer No.
field, enter 60000.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/07/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/07/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Order Date field, enter 02/07/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Order Date field, enter 02/07/19.

trans-unit.source: On ribbon, click Navigate > Commission Recipients to confirm that the correct commission recipients are allocated to the sales order.

seg-source.mrk: On ribbon, click Navigate > Commission Recipients to confirm that the correct commission recipients are allocated to the sales order.

trans-unit.source: : Commission Recipients assigned to the sales order

seg-source.mrk: : Commission Recipients assigned to the sales order

trans-unit.source: Close the Sales Commission Recipients page.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Sales Commission Recipients page.

trans-unit.source: On the first sales line, select Item in the Type field.

seg-source.mrk: On the first sales line, select Item in the Type field.

trans-unit.source: In the No. field, enter 1964-W.

seg-source.mrk: In the No.
field, enter 1964-W.

trans-unit.source: In the Location Code field, enter BLUE.

seg-source.mrk: In the Location Code field, enter BLUE.

trans-unit.source: In the Quantity field, type 5.

seg-source.mrk: In the Quantity field, type 5.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: With the Ship and Invoice option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Ship and Invoice option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click No to close the confirmation message without opening the posted invoice.

seg-source.mrk: Click No to close the confirmation message without opening the posted invoice.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click New and then press ENTER.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click New and then press ENTER.

trans-unit.source: In the Sell-to Customer No. field, enter 61000.

seg-source.mrk: In the Sell-to Customer No.
field, enter 61000.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/14/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/14/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Order Date field, enter 02/14/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Order Date field, enter 02/14/19.

trans-unit.source: Review the allocated Commission Recipients as needed.

seg-source.mrk: Review the allocated Commission Recipients as needed.

trans-unit.source: On the first sales line, select Item in the Type field.

seg-source.mrk: On the first sales line, select Item in the Type field.

trans-unit.source: In the No. field, enter 1964-W.

seg-source.mrk: In the No.
field, enter 1964-W.

trans-unit.source: In the Location Code field, enter BLUE.

seg-source.mrk: In the Location Code field, enter BLUE.

trans-unit.source: In the Quantity field, type 3.

seg-source.mrk: In the Quantity field, type 3.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: With the Ship and Invoice option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Ship and Invoice option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click No to close the confirmation message without opening the posted invoice.

seg-source.mrk: Click No to close the confirmation message without opening the posted invoice.

trans-unit.source: Automatically Create Commission Statements

seg-source.mrk: Automatically Create Commission Statements

trans-unit.source: At the end of the month, Arnie, the accounts receivable administrator, creates the monthly commission statements for Mark and Adam.

seg-source.mrk: At the end of the month, Arnie, the accounts receivable administrator, creates the monthly commission statements for Mark and Adam.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create an automated commission statement:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create an automated commission statement:

trans-unit.source: On the cc|commission menu, click Create Commission Statements.

seg-source.mrk: On the cc|commission menu, click Create Commission Statements.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Document Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Document Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Statement from field, enter 02/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Statement from field, enter 02/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Statement to field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Statement to field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: On the Commission Recipient FastTab, enter C-0002|C-0005 in the No. field.

seg-source.mrk: On the Commission Recipient FastTab, enter C-0002|C-0005 in the No.
field.

trans-unit.source: : Create Commission Statement for both Adam and Mark

seg-source.mrk: : Create Commission Statement for both Adam and Mark

trans-unit.source: Click OK to run the Create Commission Statement batch job.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to run the Create Commission Statement batch job.

trans-unit.source: Verify Commission Lines

seg-source.mrk: Verify Commission Lines

trans-unit.source: After he has created the commission statement for Mark and Adam, Arnie checks the commission statement and verifies the values.

seg-source.mrk: After he has created the commission statement for Mark and Adam, Arnie checks the commission statement and verifies the values.

trans-unit.source: To check the commission statement and verifying the values:

seg-source.mrk: To check the commission statement and verifying the values:

trans-unit.source: On the cc|commission menu, click Commission Statements.

seg-source.mrk: On the cc|commission menu, click Commission Statements.

trans-unit.source: Locate and open the commission statement for Adam Green.

seg-source.mrk: Locate and open the commission statement for Adam Green.

trans-unit.source: : Commission Statement for Adam

seg-source.mrk: : Commission Statement for Adam

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Calculation Information. Confirm the information, for example, that the calculation only uses 25% of the commission amount to calculate the commission.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Calculation Information.
Confirm the information, for example, that the calculation only uses 25% of the commission amount to calculate the commission.

trans-unit.source: : Commission line information for Adam

seg-source.mrk: : Commission line information for Adam

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: The commission percentage is adjusted to reflect the 25% share requirement.

seg-source.mrk: The commission percentage is adjusted to reflect the 25% share requirement.

trans-unit.source: Close the Commission Line Information and Commission Statement pages.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Commission Line Information and Commission Statement pages.

trans-unit.source: Locate and open the commission statement for Mark Colins.

seg-source.mrk: Locate and open the commission statement for Mark Colins.

trans-unit.source: : Commission Statement for Mark showing different commissions based on posting dates

seg-source.mrk: : Commission Statement for Mark showing different commissions based on posting dates

trans-unit.source: Notice that the lines have different commission values due to the date on which the sales documents were posted. This is not the case for Adam (refer to <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref287357724" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 4</MadCap:xref>), who did not have validity dates assigned for the sale of this item.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the lines have different commission values due to the date on which the sales documents were posted.

This is not the case for Adam (refer to <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref287357724" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 4</MadCap:xref>), who did not have validity dates assigned for the sale of this item.

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Calculation Information. Confirm the information, for example, that the calculation uses 100% of the commission amount to calculate the commission.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Calculation Information.
Confirm the information, for example, that the calculation uses 100% of the commission amount to calculate the commission.

trans-unit.source: : Commission line information for Mark

seg-source.mrk: : Commission line information for Mark

trans-unit.source: Close the Commission Line Information and Commission Statement pages.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Commission Line Information and Commission Statement pages.

trans-unit.source: Issue Commission Statements

seg-source.mrk: Issue Commission Statements

trans-unit.source: After Arnie checks the commission statements, he issues and then prints the commission statement for Mark and Adam to use it as the basis for the payment.

seg-source.mrk: After Arnie checks the commission statements, he issues and then prints the commission statement for Mark and Adam to use it as the basis for the payment.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to issue and print issued commission statements:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to issue and print issued commission statements:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon of the Commission Statements list page, click Issue.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon of the Commission Statements list page, click Issue.

trans-unit.source: On the Commission Statement Header FastTab, enter CS-10005|CS-10006 in the No. field (the commission statements for Adam and Mark).

seg-source.mrk: On the Commission Statement Header FastTab, enter CS-10005|CS-10006 in the No.
field (the commission statements for Adam and Mark).

trans-unit.source: : Issue Commission Statement for Adam and Mark

seg-source.mrk: : Issue Commission Statement for Adam and Mark

trans-unit.source: Click OK to run the Issue Commission Statement batch job.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to run the Issue Commission Statement batch job.

trans-unit.source: On the cc|commission menu, click Issued Commission Statements.

seg-source.mrk: On the cc|commission menu, click Issued Commission Statements.

trans-unit.source: Select the last issued commission statement for Adam (ICS-10002) and then click Print.

seg-source.mrk: Select the last issued commission statement for Adam (ICS-10002) and then click Print.

trans-unit.source: : Printing Commission Statement for Adam

seg-source.mrk: : Printing Commission Statement for Adam

trans-unit.source: Click Preview to review the commission statement for Adam.

seg-source.mrk: Click Preview to review the commission statement for Adam.

trans-unit.source: : Printed Commission Statement for Adam

seg-source.mrk: : Printed Commission Statement for Adam

trans-unit.source: Close the Print Preview page.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Print Preview page.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 5–7 to review the commission statement (ICS-10003) for Mark.

seg-source.mrk: Repeat steps 5–7 to review the commission statement (ICS-10003) for Mark.

trans-unit.source: : Printed Commission Statement for Mark

seg-source.mrk: : Printed Commission Statement for Mark

trans-unit.source: Close the Print Preview page.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Print Preview page.
